page.title: 15Britannia Coconut Dancers :1
page.content:
The Britannia Coconutters are a group of Morris Dancers unique to this area. With blackened faces they dance through the streets every Easter Saturday wearing black jerseys, red and white skirts, white hats decorated with feathers, white stockings and shiny black clogs.
Their dances were supposedly brought to Cornwall by North African sailors who settled firstly in Cornwall, then moved north to Lancashire's quarries and mines in the 18th and 19th centuries.
The two main dances are the Garland Dance and the Coconut Dance. The former is a ritual dance of spring using garlands of red, white and blue paper flowers.
